page.title: 17Bookham's Village Magazine
page.content:
The{Bookhams Bulletin}was first pub- lished by Leatherhead Social Services in 1931 with theaim of informing the village of local events. During WW2 it was used to publish, explain & advise on Government regulations.
In 1949 it was taken over by the BCA, who published articles of general interest to the village and a list of groups & clubs with contacts. Over the years the format has changed, but its value to residents, particularly new ones, remains.
Mrs Harrison,MA, founder of the BCA was its most distinguished editor and carried out the job for 20 years.
4000 copies are published quarterly & distributed free to every house. They are subsidised by adverts & the BCA.
